AdditionalFields.Value: Population Sciences,Bioinformatics / Convergence Science / Systems Biology,Survivorship

Description: Randomized clinical trials front-load statistical inputs in the form of study design that simplifies subsequent data analysis. With non-randomized studies, study design may not be relied on to support causal inference; thus, statistical methods must be back-loaded in the data analysis to address the bias inherent in real-world data and generate reliable, reproducible findings. In this session, three speakers will focus on the key features that can improve the scientific rigor of non-randomized real-world studies.
SearchResultBody: MW015. Design and Analysis of Real-World Data for Cancer Research
Title: Design and Analysis of Real-World Data for Cancer Research
